abstracts.cdata!:
The Andhra Pradesh Irrigation Project
            consists of: (i) completion of the Nagarjunasagar Left Main
            Canal (about 65 miles) and construction of irrigation and
            drainage facilities for the NSP Left Bank area; (ii)
            completion of the Nagarjunasagar Right Main Canal (about 29
            miles) and construction of irrigation and drainage
            facilities for the NSP Right Bank area; (iii)
            rehabilitation, upgrading or construction of about 1,575 km
            of village roads in the NSP command area; (iv) command area
            development covering 72,000 hectares of land in the four
            major irrigation sytems mentioned above; (v) a program to
            monitor water use efficiencies in NSP and crop yields in the
            four project areas; (vii) extension service assistance; and
            (viii) assistance for a project preparation and evaluation
            group in GOI's Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation.
